title: Polar factorization theorem
summary: In optimal transport, a branch of mathematics, polar factorization of vector fields is a basic result due to Brenier (1987),[1] with antecedents of Knott-Smith (1984)[2] and Rachev (1985),[3] that generalizes many existing results among which are the polar decomposition of real matrices, and the rearrangement of real-valued functions.
